medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever to 100.1, leukocytosis, palpitations, and stomach pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with stomach pain after a get-together, initially feeling like heartburn and unrelieved by Tums. The patient experienced distressing palpitations and was unable to sleep due to heart racing. Fever noted at 100.1, pulse increased to 108.
medical_history.past_medical_history: LAD MI with cardiogenic shock s/p LVAD, R MCA/ACA ischemic CVA with residual left-sided paralysis, afib s/p cardioversion, vtach s/p ICD, HIT, Lyme disease, nephrolithiasis, and anemia.
medical_history.family_history: Father had CABG and history of stroke; mother had recent recurrent breast cancer; 1 sister and 2 brothers alive and well.
